page.title: 20FOREST OF DEAN - POETRY
page.content:
{FOREST SHEEP.K.W.MORGAN (TRANSLATION)
WOOLLY HEADED FOREST SHEEP YOU'VE GOT MORE RIGHTS THAN I YOU CAN WANDER WHERE YOU PLEASE WHERE I MUST PASS ON BY. YOU CAN'T BE HALF AS STUPID AS YOU DO FIRST APPEAR 'CAUSE NO ONE EVER BOTHERS YOU OR SO IT DOES APPEAR. IF YOU LIE DOWN IN THE ROAD AND HAVE YOURSELF A SLEEP NO ONE EVER MOVES YOU ON 'CAUSE YOU ARE FOREST SHEEP. YOU DON'T WORK TO GET YOUR BREAD YOU DON'T RISE AT SEVEN IF I WAS FREE AS YOU ARE FREE I'D THINK I WAS IN HEAVEN WOOLLY HEADED FOREST SHEEP I WISH I WAS ONE TOO THEN I COULD WANDER THROUGH THE WOODS SIDE BY SIDE WITH YOU.
